arm_group.description: The premature infants with low cord blood vitamin D level
The premature infants with normal vitamin D level

brief_summary.textblock:
Experimental and observational studies have shown that vitamin D deficiency may be
      associated with an increased risk for non-bone diseases and/or abnormal development for the
      other systems of fetus. The aim of this study is to determine the relationship between cord
      blood 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25 (OH) D) concentrations and the subsequent risk of morbidities
      including RDS, PDA, NEC, BPD AND ROP in preterm infants.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cord Blood 25(oh)-Vitamin D Level in Preterm Infants and Associated Morbidities

detailed_description.textblock:
It was shown that vitamin D play important role in the pathogenesis of long term morbidities
      of newborn. Experimental and observational studies have shown that vitamin D deficiency may
      be associated with an increased risk for non-bone diseases and/or abnormal development for
      the other systems of fetus. The aim of this study is to determine the relationship between
      cord blood 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25 (OH) D) concentrations and the subsequent risk of
      morbidities including RDS, PDA, NEC, BPD AND ROP in preterm infants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  infants <32 weeks of gestational age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  infants with major congenital abnormality

          -  infants >32 weeks of gestational age

clinical_study.keyword: vitamin D, Respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, preterm
clinical_study.official_title: Is Higher Cord Blood 25(Oh)-Vitamin D Level Preventive For Any Morbidity Including Rds, Pda, Nec, Bpd And Rop In Preterm Infants

primary_outcome.description: The association of vitamin D level with respiratory distress syndrome

reference.citation: Grant WB. Vitamin D supplementation of mother and infant could reduce risk of sepsis in premature infants. Early Hum Dev. 2010 Feb;86(2):133. doi: 10.1016/j.earlhumdev.2010.02.003. Epub 2010 Feb 25.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Association of vitamin D level with sepsis

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
